value.customToken: Custom Token Generated with Private Key

database-config.createNewUser: Create a new user if this one does not exist?
database-config.clickDragHere: Click or drag the file here.

tips.apiKey: API Key can be found in the project settings.
tips.email:
If you have already created a Firebase user with an email address and password, just fill in your credentials.
On the other hand, if you have not yet created one, you can do so in two ways:
tips.emailMethod1: Go to Firebase in the Authenticate section and click on "Add User" then enter your credentials in the configuration node.
tips.emailMethod2: Enter directly into the configuration node, an email address and a password, the node will create a user for you. This user will appear after login in the Authenticate section.
tips.url: URL can be found in the Realtime Database console, this differs by geographic location, the link structure is as follows: https://<project-id>-default-rtdb.<continent>.firebaseddatabase.app/ or ends with .firebaseio.com for the United States.
tips.json: To generate a JSON file, go to the Firebase, in the Project Settings section, click on Service Accounts and then on Generate new private key. This will download a JSON file which you can either drop in the area or open and paste into the configuration node.
